comment: Dr. Nasseri clearly cares about her students and the content she teaches. She worked hard to make the course accessible to students with a variety of backgrounds and applicable to different fields. She gave good feedback on assignments and was happy to answer questions outside of class.
Ms. Nasseri genuinely cares for her students and wants them to learn and succeed and it shows in her teaching and grading policies and decisions.
What a nice person and great professor. 10/10

She is a great professor for MATLAB online or in person. Her lectures are clear and easy to understand. Passing the quizzes and tests are easy if you just use MATLAB throughout the course. Couple of group projects that are a little difficult but nothing too crazy. Overall would recommend.

Only good engineering prof at KSU
Wants you to succeed, gives you all the tools and equation sheets are comprehensive.
Overall class is hard, but interesting and very doable if you put any effort in.
She brings real life examples to every class and is always relating the math to real stuff.
Not an easy A

She teaches a great online MATLAB class. She has I think 3 group assignments, but she's fair and will grade you on your participation within your group. She gives good feedback on your project checkups, so fix what she tells you and you'll get a good grade. Her quizzes are pretty simple, and she teaches the basics of MATLAB very well!
Protect this woman at all costs. Legit the best professor I've ever had, and I'm not even done with the course yet. She genuinely cares about student success.

One of the best professors. Truly cares about students and offers extra credit to better your exams. Barely any homework and you'll learn from her through demonstrations and problems done in class. I would take her for any class and she's super nice and offers mind breaks during lectures. Gives formula sheet for exam and has everything you need.

Amazing professor for matlab. I loved the feedback she would give to me on my assignments and It really was amazing the growth I had in the class. She wrote the book that she uses but it is so useful for other classes so it is worth it!

100% online, the lecture videos are great. Dr. Nasseri wrote the textbook, helpful for example problems. Quizzes tied to the textbook learning system were not easy, but they didn't impact your grade too much. Tests much more straight forward. Two group projects account for a large % of your grade. Pray you get decent group mates, I know I did not.

I have taken Prof Nasseri for 3 classes so far. She diversifies the type of assignments she gives. Always 1 or 2 group projects; a few quizzes,3 tests, hardest test may be online towards end of semester when theres a lot of cumulative information. Additionally she never got mad when we asked a question and you knew she was always listening to you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is amazing, if you have the opportunity to take her make sure you do! Her manufacturing online class was well organized. She goes out of her way to help students.

She is a great professor who cares about her students and will help them understand the things they are struggling with in the class. Her class can be difficult material wise but if you put in the work you will do well. The lectures are taught in an effective way making the material easier to understand while providing lots of example problems.

Easiest 3000 level class ever. Each week she gives you a few PowerPoints to read, and you take a quiz on it. Every few weeks you'll have a test. All online, all open note, no lockdown browser. Very interesting material!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Nasseri is one of the kindest professors here! Her lectures are fantastic and clear, and she make sure everyone is on the same page before moving on. She lets us take a break in the middle of class! She doesn't give homework, and most of the grades are based on tests. Her tests are very similar to problems she does in class, so not bad at all.

This class was very informative and I enjoyed learning about the material. The powerpoints take a while to get through, but as long as you study them and do some practice, you should be able to get the grade that you want. I would recommend her to anyone. She is very easy to reach outside of class to answer any and all questions.

This class is very difficult and requires a lot of studying. The lectures were nice and easy to follow, but stil just difficult material. Prof. Nasseri was very easy to reach outside of class, and worked with me to help catch up when I fell behind and she motivated me to do my best. I take Dr. Nasseri's classes whenever they are offered.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I learned a lot from this professor and the textbook was very comprehensible. Practice and studying go a long way to acheive the grades you want. The professor is very knowledgable and you will learn a lot from this class. Expect at least one group project, at least when I took the class that will help prepare you for the real world.
Easy class. Easy professor. Not a ton of work, but if you do it you will get an A. She is available outside of class.

Her online class consisted of no lectures but instead 30 powerpoints for the semester, most of them 20+ pages but since there are no lectures to watch you can learn at your own pace. HWs are somewhat challenging and the tests are similar to the quizzes, good professor and easily accessible through email. I'd take her again for sure.

Dr. Nasseri has a deep knowledge of design and manufacturing. I can tell with confidence that she was the best professor in the ME department for me. She is very supportive. I enjoyed her lectures and the videos that she provided for us. Also, she has mentored many students in an SME organization that you should join. Do not hesitate to take class.

Dr. Nasseri has been by far one of my favorite professors. I will try to take her again whenever I get a chance. Her lectures are very informational and to the point. If you watch the lectures and do the practice problems you will get an A on each test. She truly cares and wants you to learn the information. Take her if you get the chance!

Prof. Nasseri is a wonderful professor. She made much effort with us during the entire semester and was friendly and nice with us in this course. Her style in teaching this course was amazing. She helped us understand the course topics deeply and relate them to actual practical and industrial experience. I'm very grateful to her for everything.

She is a great professor, mentor, & advisor. Her leadership is remarkable. She taught us to be responsible. She provided additional guidance for us students to be able to successfully navigate the course curriculum. Her drive to motivate students is exemplary; she takes time to answer questions and help us. I would recommend her classes to anyone!

PAY EXTRA attention to the quiz and exam question, a few of them answer will be looks like right. her question is a little bit tricky. a lot of lectures. do not fall behind. stay up with the lecture videos that she post before too late. it's not one night's study to pass the exam.
Made the course manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her teaching was easy to follow along with, she encourages free-thinking, and wants you to succeed in MATLAB. She put in a massive effort the whole semester to answer questions and provide solutions. Lecture videos were a bit dull, but the content was very rich and I learned a lot. Would love to take her again, she wrote the book on the subject!

I took Dr. Nasseri for ENGR3125 and also worked with her on her research projects as an URA. She is a wonderful professor and educator and will always work with you to ensure your success and understanding of the material. I highly recommend taking her for any class, you won't regret it!

I took ME 6210 - Advanced Manufacturing with Dr. Nasseri. In my undergrad studies, and graduate so far, it was the first course I could relate to real world applications from the get go. The class was rigorous, we read from the textbook and current articles. I learned a lot, and Dr. Nasseri was available to help. Prompt communication, and feedback!

Bless her soul, Dr. Nasseri is amazing! Lectures are readily available on the platform, and her assignments expectations were clear. The group assignments were also fun and well-thought out, and solving these problems were very provocative. Despite being an asynchronous classroom, she was surprisingly engaging, and I loved learning in her class!

She is a sweetheart! This was an asynchronous class, and her lectures were super easy to watch. Her textbook is worth buying too, as her quizzes often pull from info not on lectures. She understands the COVID struggle and gave lots of extra credit. No final, just a big technical report with code. Personally, an easy A with limited effort.
Great Professor. She is very helpful. I learned a lot, and her lectures teach a lot.
One of the best professors at KSU. Takes time to answer questions and always tries to help students out
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: not just from the school, she is one of the best professor in the world. if you want to be successful in life and KSU, take her class.

I absolutely adore Prof. Nasseri. She is very clear and funny with her lectures. I really enjoyed learning MATLAB from her. Really review your in-class examples for the test, and I would get the book, but you could get away without it. The case study at the end is super fun. You really feel like you learn the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: It's not everyday in your college career that you find an excellent professor like Dr. Nasseri. She is very sharp and yet humble; her explanations help gear your mind towards being able to understand and apply what you learn. I had her for both Manufacturing Processes and Machine Dynamics and Vibrations. Strongly recommend taking her when you can!

We get HW quizzes every week or two weeks watch out for those cause they are a good chunk of your grade, her tests in this class are based off the quizzes and notes she gives us. If you study this class is an easy A. She has powerpoint notes that replace a textbook so there is no need to get a textbook.

I enjoyed this class (Tool design) more than any of my other classes. Professor Nasseri makes every class engaging (she asks you questions and we have discussions) and she explains things pretty well. The tests were pretty difficult, but if you study her notes you should do fine. She is always helpful and kind to her students.

This is a great class (Matlab) and I would recommend taking it with Professor Nasseri. She makes each class interesting and relevant, she explains everything thoroughly and clearly and she has a great personality and love for her students and wishes for everyone to succeed. Put in the effort and try your best and you'll do fine.

I took an online Manufacturing processes class with this teacher. The class was very easy. (Online classes seem to be a joke) I only had to read the chapter the night before the test and I got an A in the class. Doesn't really reflect the teacher, but something to keep in mind.

I had this professor for an online class.  I am almost 50 and been back in school 5 years.  This is the fairest, most helpful professor I have had.  She very smart and shares her knowledge.  If you have a chance take this prof just to be reminded some professors do care if you learn or not.  I had to study and didn't make an A but it was good
Excellent professor. Clear, fair, helpful, knows her stuff. Really cares about the students progress. One of the best.!
Great Teacher, will take her classes anytime I can get them. Brilliant and excellent communicator.  Tough, you better show up, pay attention, and get your work done, if you do, you will learn a lot!

Professor Nasseri is the smartest most modest person I've ever met.  She and professor Russell and Conrey should win teacher of the year every year. But seriously, if I could take every class with her I would.  She is extremely smart and she cares so much about her students and whether they succeed.  Take her if you can as much as you can!

I took this class online and had a great experience. Nasseri is an excellent teacher who provided well organized PowerPoint presentations that coordinated with the text book material, and she was prompt in answering e-mails. Keep up with the book reading, PowerPoints and on-line assignments and you'll learn effectively and do well on the tests.

Knows the material very well, Teaches from PowerPoint, overly helpful to some students while not helpful to others, breezes through the foundation material while hammering you with the harder principals

Amazing Professor!  Best professor I've had so far.  Eager to help in any situations.  Test are challenging, but not hard if you go to class and do the Homework.  Great sense of Humor!  Had her for three classes and will take any class I can with her.  Would recommend her to anyone!Extremely intelligent and well prepared for class.

One of the best professors in the mechanical dept. An asset to SPSU. Great professor and good sense of humor. The difficulty seems about right if you study and do the work. I learned bunches from this class.

She is by far the best and coolest teacher at SPSU.  Dr. Nasseri has a great sense of humor and I really like her accent.  She should get the best teacher of the year award. She is also the most helpful teacher I've ever had.  I highly recommend taking her... I wish she taught more courses that I'm required to take though.

Dr. Nasseri is a great teacher, my favorite at SPSU. She is very helpful if you just ask. Stay on her good side and she will reward you for it. Just study and listen to her talks. She does not seem very mechanical in practice but knows a lot about it in theory, sounds like a GT grad!

Hard to understand her accent sometimes.  Teaches directly from powerpoint.  The slides are available for download, though.  I liked the class, overall.  Very little homework.  Lots of info to absorb, though.
Awesome teacher. She was very helpful and knows her stuff. The tests were easy if you studied and showed up to class. I highly recommend her to anyone.
She has a new teaching style and teaches the material very well, yet be aware of multiple choice. Be very alert doing exams. I would take her again if I could!

Very easy class. Pretty much the same material as manufacturing processes.  If you actually want to learn, don't take this class. I'm almost positive that she's never welded or even been in a machine shop, so you do the math. If you want an A this class is definitely for you!!!!

The Powerpoints are very useful for a person who learns visual.  Also, The instructor focuses on a student who wants to learn the information and not just the competitive student who just needs that A.   When asked to work examples, the professor will work them.  The material itself is boring but the professor tries to make it interesting.
You will like her. Strange but funny sense of humor. Easy A if you put in just a LITTLE bit of work. Thick accent and hard to understand sometimes.

She is new to SPSU from Australia. Being new took her some time to find her bearings but she does know her stuff. Exams were not hard gave a lot of hwk which helped in understanding matl . Only thing is..and this might be personal most lectures are on powerpoint.. this was a STATICS class where we calculated alot. She did alot of examples though
Awesome professor! We had alot of fun in her lab class. Very different scence of humor but got halrious once you get to know her.
